thread.title: NSW Liberal Party begins probe into alleged donations to Ray Williams
thread.title_full: NSW Liberal Party begins probe into alleged donations to Ray Williams

title: NSW Liberal Party begins probe into alleged donations to Ray Williams
text:
NSW Minister Ray Williams under scrutiny over alleged donations from property developers Posted February 22, 2017 08:08:53 Map: Castle Hill 2154 
New South Wales Premier Gladys Berejiklian has asked the Liberal Party to look into the affairs of one of her newly-appointed ministers, Ray Williams, after allegations he was accepting donations from property developers. 
It has been claimed the Multicultural Minister accepted dozens of donations from some of Sydney's big-name property developers. 
The payments escaped scrutiny of the Electoral Commission because they came in just below the threshold of $1,000. 
In a statement, Ms Berejiklian said the NSW Government took the issue of political donations very seriously and had taken a number of steps in recent years to improve transparency and accountability. 
"I expect all MPs to maintain the highest standards of integrity and to comply with all relevant donations requirements," she said. 
"Political donations are managed by the NSW Liberal Party and I have asked the Party to investigate these claims. 
"If any allegations of wrongdoing emerge, they will be referred to the NSW Electoral Commission." 
A NSW Liberal Party spokeswoman said the party was aware of the allegations and was reviewing its records, adding the party always sought to fully comply with NSW electoral laws.
